file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-41-02-04 - LANDING LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LANDING LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the landing light lamp and landing light assembly. B. The landing lights are installed on the nose landing gear (NLG) and on the RH and LH inboard wing leading edges. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 33-41-02-000-801-A LANDING LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL ALL 33-41-02-400-801-A LANDING LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION ALL 33-41-02-000-802-A LANDING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL LANDING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLA- ALL 33-41-02-400-802-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-41-02 Page 1 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-41-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. LANDING LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the landing light lamp. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose Landing Gear 611 Inboard wing leading edge - RH 511 Inboard wing leading edge - LH C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Plastic Spatula To remove the seal 1 available E. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Commercially available Cloth which does not release lints AR RTV-157 Adhesive/Sealant AR MEP 13-073 Cleaning solvent (Rhodiasolve E-23) AR F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE At the Nose Landing Gear, RH and LH in- 1 Does the task board wing leading edges H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the LDG 1, NOSE, and LDG 2 switches, on the overhead panel, are in the OFF position. (2) Remove the lens of the landing lights from the LH and RH inboard wing leading edges. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-02 Page 2 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the lamp of the NLG landing light. (a) Remove the bolt (5) and washer (6). (b) Remove the clamp (4). (c) Carefully pull out the lamp (3). (d) Remove the two screws (1) from the terminals (2). (e) Remove the lamp (3). (2) Remove the lamp of the landing light of the LH and RH inboard wing leading edges. (a) Remove the bolt (13) and the washer (12). (b) Remove the clamp (14). (c) Carefully pull out the lamp (11) from the light assembly. (d) Remove the two screws (9) from the terminals (10). (e) Remove the lamp (11). (f) If the seal (15) is damaged, replace the seal from the clamp (14) as follows: 1 Use a plastic spatula to remove the damaged seal (15) from the clamp (14) and discard it. 2 Use a clean cloth moist with cleaning solvent to remove old adhesive residues from the clamp (15). WARNING: WARNING: AIR PRESSURE MUST NOT BE OF MORE THAN 30 PSI (270 KPA). OR INJURY OR DEATH TO PERSONNEL CAN OCCUR. 3 Dry the parts with compressed air or wipe them with a clean cloth and let them air-dry. WARNING: ADHESIVE IS VERY FLAMMABLE. DO NOT INHALE ITS VAPORS AND DO NOT LET IT TOUCH YOUR SKIN. OBEY THE FIRE PRECAUTIONS. 4 5 Apply adhesive to the mating surface of the new seal (15). 6 Put the seal (15) on the clamp (14). Use a clean cloth to remove excess adhesive. Let it air-dry for 4 hours. (g) If the seal (8) is damaged, replace the seal from the light assembly as follows: 1 Use a plastic spatula to remove the damaged seal (8) from the light assembly and discard it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-02 Page 3 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 2 Use a clean cloth moist with cleaning solvent to remove old adhesive residues from the light assembly. WARNING: WARNING: AIR PRESSURE MUST NOT BE OF MORE THAN 30 PSI (270 KPA). OR INJURY OR DEATH TO PERSONNEL CAN OCCUR. 3 Dry the parts with compressed air or wipe them with a clean cloth and let them air-dry. WARNING: ADHESIVE IS VERY FLAMMABLE. DO NOT INHALE ITS VAPORS AND DO NOT LET IT TOUCH YOUR SKIN. OBEY THE FIRE PRECAUTIONS. 4 5 Apply adhesive to the mating surface of the new seal (8). 6 Put the seal (8) on the light assembly. Use a clean cloth to remove excess adhesive. Let it air-dry for 4 hours. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-02 Page 4 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

BOLT 1. SCREW (2) 2. TERMINAL (2) 3. LAMP D DET. C VIEW D 4. CLAMP EM145AMM330990A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-02 Page 5 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Landing Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 2 G LIGHT ASSEMBLY G (REF.) 8. SEAL 9. SCREW (2) 10. TERMINAL (2) 11. LAMP 5 mm DET. E F 12. WASHER 14. CLAMP 13. BOLT 15. SEAL LIGHT 14. CLAMP 1 ASSEMBLY (REF.) VIEW F 15. SEAL 1 8. SEAL LANDING LIGHT LAMP (REF.) SECTION G-G 1 EM145AMM330991A.DGN ADHESIVE RTV-157 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-41-02 Page 6 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-41-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. LANDING LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the landing light lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-41-00-700-801-A/500 LANDING LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose Landing Gear 611 Inboard wing leading edge - RH 511 Inboard wing leading edge - LH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE At the Nose Landing Gear, RH and LH in- 1 Does the task board wing leading edges I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the lamp of the NLG landing light. (a) Install the two terminals (2) with the screws (1). (b) Install the lamp (3). NOTE: The tube (7) must be horizontal when assembled. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-41-02 Page 7 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CAUTION:AFTER INSTALLATION, THE CLAMP ATTACHMENT POINT MUST FORM AN ANGLE OF APPROXIMATELY 25ÃÂ° TO THE 6 O'CLOCK POSITION, CLOCKWISE, AS SHOWN IN DET "C" OF FIGURE 401. THIS ACTION PREVENTS INTERFERENCE BETWEEN THE CLAMP ATTACHMENT POINT AND THE LANDING GEAR DOOR. (c) Install the clamp (4) with the bolt (5) and washer (6). (2) Install the lamp of the landing light of the LH and RH inboard wing leading edges. (a) Install the two terminals (10) with the screws (9). (b) Install the lamp (11). CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT, WHEN YOU INSTALL THE CLAMP, A GAP OF 5mm STAYS BETWEEN THE TWO ENDS OF THE CLAMP. THIS IS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE LAMP. (c) Install the clamp (14) with the bolt (13) and washer (12). Refer to VIEW. F and SECTION G-G. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the operational test of the lamp installed ( AMM TASK 33-41-00-700-801-A/500). (2) Install the lens of the landing lights of the LH and RH inboard wing leading edges. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-41-02 Page 8 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-41-02-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. LANDING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Landing Light Assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 30-11-04-000-801-A/400 PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCH - REMOVAL AMM TASK 33-41-02-000-801-A/400 LANDING LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL AMM TASK 57-41-00-000-801-A/400 LEADING EDGE I - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose Landing Gear 611 Wing inboard leading edge - RH 511 Wing inboard leading edge - LH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE At the Nose Landing Gear, RH and LH 1 Does the task wing inboard leading edges I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the LDG 1, NOSE, and LDG 2 switches, on the overhead panel, are in the OFF position. (2) Remove the leading edge ( AMM TASK 57-41-00-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the landing light lamp ( AMM TASK 33-41-02-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-41-02 Page 9 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Remove the piccolo pressure-drop switch (AMM TASK 30-11-04-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (5) Remove the tubes of the anti-icing system. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove the landing light assembly of the NLG, as follows: (a) Remove the electrical cable. (b) Remove the nut (1), washer (2), bolt (4), and washer (5). (c) Remove the landing light assembly (3). (2) Remove the landing light assembly of the LH and RH wing inboard leading edges, as follows: (a) Remove the two screws (2). (b) Remove the three bolts (3) and washers (4). (c) Remove the landing light assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-41-02 Page 10 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Landing Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 402 A ZONE 711 B B ZONE ZONE 611 511 C DET. B D 5. WASHER 4. BOLT DET. A 1. NUT 2. WASHER 1. LANDING LIGHT 4. WASHER (3) ASSEMBLY 3. LANDING LIGHT ASSEMBLY DET. C 3. BOLT (3) DET. D 2. SCREW (2) 145AMM330101.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-41-02 Page 11 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-41-02-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. LANDING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Landing Light Assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCH - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 30-11-04-400-801-A/400 TION AMM TASK 33-41-00-700-801-A/500 LANDING LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 33-41-02-400-801-A/400 LANDING LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 57-41-00-400-801-A/400 LEADING EDGE I - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose Landing Gear 611 Wing inboard leading edge - RH 511 Wing inboard leading edge - LH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE At the Nose Landing Gear, LH and RH 1 Does the task wing inboard leading edges I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the landing light assembly of the NLG, as follows: (a) Install the landing light assembly (3). (b) Install the bolt (4) with washer (5), washer (2), and nut (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-41-02 Page 12 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Install the electrical cable. (2) Install the landing light assembly of the LH and RH wing inboard leading edges, as follows: (a) Install the landing light assembly (1). (b) Install the three bolts (3) with the washers (4). (c) Install the two screws (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Install the tubes of the anti-icing system. (2) Install the piccolo pressure-drop switch (AMM TASK 30-11-04-400-801-A/400), if applicable. (3) Install the landing light lamp ( AMM TASK 33-41-02-400-801-A/400). (4) Install the leading edge ( AMM TASK 57-41-00-400-801-A/400). (5) Do the operational test of the lamp installed ( AMM TASK 33-41-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-41-02 Page 13 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
